entries.title: Drax: UK power station owner cuts down primary forests in Canada
entries.description: The owner of the UK's biggest power station, Drax, is cutting down key forests in Canada.

entries.title: Questions over France's contribution to Ukraine war
entries.description: Paris's relative absence in its supply of weapons to Ukraine leaves eastern European countries wary.

entries.title: King Charles and Queen Consort to visit Dunfermline and Edinburgh
entries.description: They will make their first joint public appearance since the period of royal mourning ended.

entries.title: Chris Mason: Anguish at conference that should be Truss's victory lap
entries.description: What has happened in the last 10 days could leave an indelible mark on Liz Truss, some Tories fear.

entries.title: What happens when all the banks leave town?
entries.description: Could a new "banking hub" solve the problems caused by the departure of five banks from Brechin?

entries.title: Ancient footprints reveal 'Irish Sea Serengeti'
entries.description: Prehistoric footprints on Formby Beach have revealed how the British coast transformed over 9,000 years.

entries.title: Sir Bradley Wiggins backs NSPCC campaign to prevent child abuse in sport
entries.description: Sir Bradley Wiggins joins former Manchester City player Paul Stewart and the FA to back an NSPCC campaign against child abuse in sport.

entries.title: Match of the Day 2 analysis: Manchester United's 'shocking' display
entries.description: Match of the Day 2 pundit Jermaine Jenas analyses Manchester United's "shocking" display in their 6-3 Premier League derby defeat at Manchester City.

entries.title: Tory conference: Liz Truss will lose 45p tax rate vote, says Shapps
entries.description: Ex-cabinet minister accuses PM of not listening to public concern over tax cuts for the well-off.

entries.title: Iran protests: Reports of students trapped amid clashes in Tehran
entries.description: Reports say a large number of student protesters at Sharif university have been trapped on the campus.

entries.title: Tory conference: We must stay the course, insists Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng
entries.description: Kwasi Kwarteng will defend his tax cuts during his Conservative Party conference speech.

entries.title: LPGA Tour: Charley Hull wins second title with victory in The Ascendant
entries.description: Solheim Cup player Charley Hull wins for the second time on the LPGA Tour with a one-shot victory at The Ascendant in Texas.

entries.title: Men's T20 World Cup: Ben Stokes, Jos Buttler & Alex Hales among England's conundrums
entries.description: Why England have some nice conundrums to solve before they line up for their first T20 World Cup match against Afghanistan.

entries.title: Leeds United 0-0 Aston Villa: Jesse Marsch 'felt sorry for fans' at Villa's tactics.
entries.description: Leeds United boss Jesse Marsch says he "felt sorry for the fans" after accusing Aston Villa of repeated timewasting in their goalless draw.

entries.title: Tory conference: Labour favourites to win power at next election, says John Curtice
entries.description: Liz Truss is now as unpopular with voters as Boris Johnson when he was ousted, says veteran pollster.

entries.title: England in Pakistan: Dawid Malan guides tourists to Twenty20 series win
entries.description: Dawid Malan hits an unbeaten 78 as England beat Pakistan by 67 runs in the seventh T20 international to clinch a 4-3 series win.

entries.title: Erling Haaland is Cristiano Ronaldo, Zlatan Ibrahimovic & more superstars in one
entries.description: Erling Haaland is Cristiano Ronaldo, Zlatan Ibrahimovic and other elite strikers in one player, as the game reacts to another hat-trick for the Manchester City forward.

entries.title: Leeds United 0-0 Aston Villa: Luis Sinisterra sent off for hosts in goalless draw
entries.description: Leeds battle to earn a goalless draw with Aston Villa despite playing with only 10 men for the majority of the second half.

entries.title: Brexit: Steve Baker sorry over behaviour towards Ireland during talks
entries.description: The Conservative MP tells his party's conference that Irish relations "are not where they should be".

entries.title: After chess, cheating rows rock poker and fishing
entries.description: Viral videos in the US have shown a surprising card game win - and fish stuffed with weights.

entries.title: Man City 6-3 Man Utd: Pep Guardiola's side too good for Erik ten Hag's men
entries.description: Manchester United's derby thrashing is a cold shower for anyone at Old Trafford thinking they might be moving closer to the side they hope to challenge.

entries.title: Mel B calls for more victim support at Tory conference
entries.description: The campaigner was there as "Melanie Brown MBE", rather than as a Spice Girl, she says.

entries.title: Man City 6-3 Man Utd: Erik ten Hag criticises 'unacceptable' lack of belief
entries.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says his side "let the fans down" in an "unacceptable" 6-3 defeat by rivals Manchester City.

entries.title: Singapore Grand Prix: Sergio Perez wins eventful wet-dry race
entries.description: Red Bull's Sergio Perez holds off Ferrari's Charles Leclerc to win an incident-packed Singapore Grand Prix run in treacherous wet-dry conditions.

entries.title: Man City 6-3 Man Utd: Haaland and Foden hat-tricks as hosts hit six
entries.description: Manchester City's Erling Haaland becomes the first player to score three successive Premier League home hat-tricks as Manchester United are humiliated.

entries.title: Bruno Lage: Wolves sack manager after defeat by West Ham
entries.description: Bruno Lage is sacked as manager of Wolves after 16 months in charge following Saturday's defeat at West Ham United.

entries.title: BBC blames 'technical glitches' for PM interview interruption
entries.description: BBC presenter Laura Kuenssberg apologised to viewers for the temporary blackout.

entries.title: Liz Truss: The prime minister's claims about the economy fact-checked
entries.description: Prime Minister Liz Truss made claims on growth, borrowing costs and mortgage rises.

entries.title: London Marathon 2022: Amos Kipruto and Yalemzerf Yehualaw win first titles in elite races
entries.description: Kenya's Amos Kipruto and Ethiopia's Yalemzerf Yehualaw win their maiden London Marathon titles with breakaway victories in the elite men's and women's races.

entries.title: Mini-budget tax changes not right, says Michael Gove
entries.description: The senior Tory says the PM's policies are "not Conservative" but Liz Truss argues they will boost growth.

entries.title: London Marathon 2022: Race attracts 42,000 participants
entries.description: An estimated 42,000 people are running the London Marathon as large crowds watch.

entries.title: Ground should have been laid for tax cuts, admits Liz Truss
entries.description: But the prime minister says she sticks by her mini budget, despite a bad reaction from the markets.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Putin's annexation will fail, say Ukrainians at eastern front
entries.description: Ukrainian forces on the eastern front in Bakhmut say they will fight for every last inch of soil.

entries.title: Fifa president Gianni Infantino says it is a 'dark day' for football after Indonesian stadium disaster
entries.description: Fifa president Gianni Infantino says it is a "dark day" for football after at least 174 people are killed in a crush at a match in Indonesia.

entries.title: Liu Jingyao and Liu Qiangdong: Chinese billionaire sexual assault case settled in US
entries.description: A closely-watched case where business titan Richard Liu was accused of rape was settled hours before trial.

entries.title: Kwarteng did not share tax insights at party - Tory chairman
entries.description: The Tory chairman defends the chancellor over claims he discussed future spending plans with financiers.

entries.title: Two men charged over 'assault' on Prince Andrew heckler
entries.description: The heckler was allegedly dragged to the ground as the Duke of York walked behind the Queen's coffin.

entries.title: London Marathon 2022: Marcel Hug and Catherine Debrunner set new course records in wheelchair races
entries.description: Marcel Hug and Catherine Debrunner set new course records as they completed an all-Swiss sweep of the London Marathon wheelchair titles.

entries.title: Lina Nielsen on MS diagnosis & support from twin sister Laviai
entries.description: BBC Sport talks to British 400m hurdler Lina Nielsen on her multiple sclerosis diagnosis and the support from her twin sister Laviai.

entries.title: Bellator 286: Watch fast start between AJ McKee and Spike Carlyle
entries.description: Watch the fast start between AJ McKee and Spike Carlyle in the Bellator 286 lightweight fight.

entries.title: Mark Hamill on speaking to Zelensky about Star Wars
entries.description: The Star Wars legend says Ukraine's president referenced the films when he spoke to him.

entries.title: 'Our therapy lizard keeps us really chilled'
entries.description: A disability charity uses a tegu lizard during therapy sessions.

entries.title: Child organ donation: 'We need parents to think the unthinkable'
entries.description: The family of a girl awaiting a heart transplant are asking parents to consider organ donations.

entries.title: Indonesia: At least 174 dead in football stampede
entries.description: Supporters who invaded the pitch are tear-gassed by police, leading to one of the world's worst stadium disasters.

entries.title: Bellator 286: Patricio ‘Pitbull’ Freire defends featherweight title with dominant win over Adam Borics
entries.description: Brazil's Patricio 'Pitbull' Freire defends his featherweight title at Bellator 286 with a unanimous victory over Hungarian Adam Borics.

entries.title: Badger breaks into Essex family's home during the night
entries.description: The animal is caught on camera after forcing its way through a cat flap and eating pet food.

entries.title: Lina Nielsen on MS diagnosis & support from twin sister Laviai
entries.description: BBC Sport talks to British 400m hurdler Lina Nielsen on her multiple sclerosis diagnosis and the support from her twin sister Laviai.

entries.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Voters abandon Tories' as PM defends strategy
entries.description: Polling in Sunday's papers indicates that faith in the government's economic competence is damaged.

entries.title: Bruce Willis denies selling rights to his face
entries.description: It was widely reported that the actor had sold his face to a deepfake company.
